intro: Gunniopsis kochii, commonly known as the desert daisy, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange composite flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Its leaves are typically succulent, allowing it to store moisture efficiently. Gunniopsis kochii plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining biodiversity in its ecosystem.
